articles.description:
Photo: Charlie Hall/Polygon
    

  
Computer, enhance
 Bethesda Softworks formally unveiled Starfield, its highly anticipated new role-playing game, on Sunday during the Xbox showcase. And in a surprise twist, eagle-eyed fans on Reddit have found what they think could be a teaser for Bethesda Game Studios‚Äô next new game: The Elder Scrolls 6. We‚Äôve seen the evidence, and ... yeah. There could definitely be a big, fat Easter egg hidden in plain sight.
[Warning: This story could contain spoilers for the next game in The Elder Scrolls series of single-player RPGs.]
The last single-player game in The Elder Scrolls series, The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim, was released nearly a decade ago. Since 2011, the game has been ported to nearly every digital platform, including the Nintendo Switch and virtua‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bethesda‚Äôs Starfield trailer may contain a clue about The Elder Scrolls 6

articles.description:
Image: Square Enix
    

  
Jack wants chaos? Jack gets chaos
 Square Enix revealed a new spinoff Final Fantasy game at its E3 2021 press conference on Sunday, Stranger of Paradise Final Fantasy Origin. And while a new Final Fantasy game might sound like exciting news at a conference thin with announcements, fans were quick to notice a fatal flaw with its protagonist, Jack. 
He wears a T-shirt.  
He dons a simple, black, short-sleeved shirt with buttons on the front. If it weren‚Äôt for the ragged hem hanging down over his crotch and butt, it looks like something you could buy from the men‚Äôs section at Target. It might sound like a small thing, but this is the world of Final Fantasy, where everybody and their mom usually has an ornate, whimsical character designs. And Jack is the protagonist‚Ä¶
articles.title: Fans are roasting Final Fantasy‚Äôs new hero for showing up in a T-shirt

articles.description:
Image: PlatinumGames/Square Enix
    

  
PlatinumGames‚Äô latest looks a little rough around the edges, but there‚Äôs hope
 On Sunday, Square Enix showed off new gameplay from Babylon‚Äôs Fall, the PlatinumGames-developed hack-and-slash that was first announced way back in 2018. It looked drastically different from the early gameplay preview we saw in late 2019, which made Babylon‚Äôs Fall look like a fairly traditional PlatinumGames release.
It also, frankly, looked a little ... off. What I (and others) perceived as heavily compressed streaming video artifacts obscuring the game‚Äôs graphics is actually Babylon‚Äôs Fall‚Äôs intentional art style. PlatinumGames says it‚Äôs going for a ‚Äúvisual style is based on classical European oil paintings‚Äù that it calls ‚Äúbrushwork style.‚Äù To wit, taking a closer look at direct-feed screenshots of Babylon‚Äôs Fall reveals that the graphics are being treated with a canvas-like texture and what appear to be actual brushstrokes.
‚ÄúOur goal was to create a deeply layered, high quality fantasy world rendered in the oil painting style seen in classic sword and sorcery fantasy works,‚Äù said Babylon‚Äôs Fall game director Kenji Saito in a behind-the-scenes look at development.


PlatinumGames and Square Enix tapped artist Kouji Tajima to create the game‚Äôs high-fantasy art style. Tajima‚Äôs previous work is mostly in live-action film, he says, working on movies like Terminator: Dark Fate, Venom, Blade Runner 2049, and the Fantastic Beasts series.
The most encouraging bit of news on Babylon‚Äôs Fall is who‚Äôs overseeing it, the aforementioned game director Kenji Saito. He directed Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance and Transformers Devastation, two of Platinum‚Äôs better games. He‚Äôs joined by Isao Negishi, lead game designer on Babylon‚Äôs Fall, who had the same credit on Nier: Automata.
Babylon‚Äôs Fall is coming to PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and Windows PC via Steam. Square Enix has not announced a release date.
articles.title: Babylon‚Äôs Fall could be good, actually

articles.description:
Image: 343 Industries/Microsoft
    

  
Halo multiplayer is all about hunting for power weapons
 Players got some new details around Halo Infinite‚Äôs free-to-play multiplayer during 343 Industries and Microsoft‚Äôs Halo multiplayer livestream on Monday. The livestream showed off a little more than 10 minutes of new gameplay and developer interviews. It gave 343 Industries an opportunity to deliver its philosophy for Halo Infinite's multiplayer: old school.
Early in the stream, 343 Industries developers made it clear that players will start on equal footing with ‚Äúfair and balanced starts,‚Äù and that they wanted to go back to the old-school Halo style of hunting for power weapons once you spawn. However, it‚Äôs not currently clear if Halo Infinite will have loadouts. 
Games like Halo Reach had pr‚Ä¶
articles.title: Halo Infinite‚Äôs guns rain from the sky, and all players start on equal footing

articles.description:
Image: 343 Studios/Microsoft
    

  
Infinite will also give players more customization options than ever, including the AI voice in multiplayer
 343 Industries is totally reshaping Halo‚Äôs multiplayer customization in Halo Infinite by adding a few hallmarks of popular free-to-play games. The studio released a multiplayer overview on Monday, where it revealed what players could expect for all the game‚Äôs cosmetics when it comes out later this year. 
Because Infinite is the first Halo game to feature free-to-play multiplayer, it‚Äôs no surprise that the team at 343 is ramping up cosmetics and customization. Not only does it give the developer more items to sell, but Infinite is inviting players to spend hundreds of hours in the Halo arena, and with time investment like that it‚Äôs always more fu‚Ä¶
articles.title: Halo Infinite‚Äôs battle passes will never expire

articles.description:
Image: Studio Fizbin/Mixtvision Games
    


  
Studio Fizbin‚Äôs thoughtful puzzle-platformer got a surprise release on Sunday
 You‚Äôve heard this story before. Though the details may be different, the thrust of the story is the same. When the world goes to shit, there‚Äôs only one person who can save us ‚Äî the chosen one, through their sheer power of chosen-ness, must set off on a calamitous journey to stop whatever terrible thing is threatening the world. 
It‚Äôs Link in the Legend of Zelda, Master Chief in Halo, Kratos in God of War. These sorts of heroes also appear in smaller-scale stories, in more intimate worlds, like the player-character in Cozy Grove, perpetually taking on everyone else‚Äôs needs. But being a hero can be isolating, even traumatic.
  
        
      Image: Studio Fizbin/Mix‚Ä¶
articles.title: In Minute of Islands, it‚Äôs hard to be the chosen one

articles.description:
Image: Splashteam/TinyBuild
    

  
Coming to PC and consoles in 2022
 PC gamers itching for a Pikmin-like fix have Tinykin to look forward to in 2022. The game, from developer Splashteam, stars a tiny protagonist and a small army of helpful insects ‚Äî the titular Tinykin ‚Äî was revealed Sunday during the PC Gaming Show.
Here‚Äôs the narrative setup for Tinykin:
It‚Äôs the year 2748 and Milo has re-discovered Earth! He‚Äôd go down in history for this achievement, but when he lands on the planet he encounters a problem... He‚Äôs as small as a penny. And everybody‚Äôs gone. And it‚Äôs the ‚Äô90s.

As Milo, players will explore a giant house, using Tinykin to maneuver through an oversized world by building ladders, bridges, carrying objects, and more. Milo can also jump, skate, and grind, as you can see in the game‚Äôs debut trailer above.
Tinykin is coming to Windows PC and unannounced consoles next year. Developer Splashteam is composed of ex-Ubisoft developers who have worked on the Rayman and Rabbids franchises.
articles.title: Tinykin looks like a Pikmin-inspired platformer for PC

articles.description:
Image: Rocketwerkz
    

  
The game won‚Äôt be free-to-play after all
 Icarus, the next game from DayZ creator Dean Hall‚Äôs Rocketwerkz studio, launches on Steam Aug. 11. In a surprise announcement, the session-based multiplayer survival game will not be free-to-play. Instead the game will cost $29.99, and will be released in chapters. The announcement was made Sunday during the PC Gaming Show presentation, and was accompanied by a new trailer.
‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt want the business model to get in the way of the game experience,‚Äù Hall said in a news release. ‚ÄúWe also heard loud and clear from our community that they wanted to avoid the pitfalls of free-to-play. We want Icarus to continually evolve as a living game, always adding new session challenges and game modes. We think regular chapters and content updates are a great way to deliver.‚Äù 
Icarus puts players in the role of pioneering explorers trying to tame a wild, alien world. The session-based gameplay puts a time limit on each mission, challenging players to gather resources before their ship back to orbit leaves them behind. You can read more, including an interview with Dean Hall, in our hands-on preview. 
A deluxe edition, which will include two follow-on chapters of downloadable content, will also be available for $99.95.
articles.title: Icarus, the next game from DayZ creator Dean Hall, launches Aug. 11

articles.description:
The sequel to Far: Lone Sails is coming this year
 Far: Changing Tides is the next game from Okomotive, a small independent studio out of Switzerland. The sequel to Far: Lone Sails, the award-winning game released in 2018, the game was announced Sunday as part of the PC Gaming Show. It will be published by Frontier Foundry, the new publishing arm of Frontier Developments (Elite Dangerous, Jurassic World Evolution).
Where Lone Sails asked players to navigate a sailing ship across a a long, dry expanse of land, Changing Tides takes place on the sea. Players will take control of a hero named Toe and must help them as they make their way through a drowning landscape. Players should expect a ‚Äúmeditative side scrolling‚Äù game with a ‚Äúhaunting soundtrack,‚Äù according to a news release.

  
        
      Image: Okomotive/Frontier Foundry
  

  
        
      Image: Okomotive/Frontier Foundry
  

  
        
      Image: Okomotive/Frontier Foundry
  

  
        
      Image: Okomotive/Frontier Foundry
  


Far: Changing Tides will launch later this year for PlayStation 5, Windows PC, and Xbox Series X. It will also be available for Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One. Fans can currently add the game to their wishlist on Steam.
articles.title: Far: Changing Tides is a meditative side-scrolling adventure

articles.description:
Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks
    

  
Not much! But Todd Howard and friends want you to dig
 Starfield is the next large-scale, AAA role-playing game from Fallout and Skyrim makers Bethesda Game Studios. It will launch Nov. 11, 2022. The spacefaring RPG, first teased in 2018, is Bethesda‚Äôs biggest all-new video game world in the past 25 years. Here‚Äôs what we know about it, so far.
WHAT IS STARFIELD?
‚ÄúSkyrim in space,‚Äù Todd Howard told The Washington Post. Howard is the executive producer for Bethesda Game Studios and the creative leader of its Elder Scrolls franchise since 2000. In other words, this is the full-featured Bethesda Game Studios RPG experience, seen in games like The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim and Fallout 5, just applied to an all-new, science fiction setting.
‚Ä¶
articles.title: Starfield: What we know about Bethesda‚Äôs next RPG

articles.description:
Image: Eidos-Montreal/Square Enix
    


  
Announcements and trailers for Marvel‚Äôs Guardians of the Galaxy, Life is Strange: True Colors, and Stranger of Paradise Final Fantasy Origin
 Square Enix made several announcements and released a handful of trailers during its E3 2021 press conference on Sunday. The event featured all-new information, announcements, and trailers for Marvel‚Äôs Guardians of the Galaxy, the War for Wakanda expansion for Marvel‚Äôs Avengers, Life is Strange: True Colors, Babylon‚Äôs Fall, Stranger of Paradise Final Fantasy Origin, and more.
Here‚Äôs a roundup of the biggest announcements from Square Enix Presents at E3 2021.
Marvel‚Äôs Guardians of the Galaxy


Years after Eidos-Montr√©al‚Äôs Marvel‚Äôs Guardians of the Galaxy game was leaked in 2017, the Deus Ex developer is fina‚Ä¶
articles.title: Square Enix Presents at E3 2021: The 5 biggest announcements

articles.description:
Image: Square Enix/Twitch
    

  
Square Enix is going full character action with a new Final Fantasy spinoff
 Ninja Gaiden and Nioh developer Team Ninja is making a new Final Fantasy spinoff game for Square Enix. Titled Stranger of Paradise Final Fantasy Origin and pitched as ‚Äúa bold new vision for Final Fantasy,‚Äù the game is scheduled to launch in 2022 on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X.
Stranger of Paradise Final Fantasy Origin is being developed by Final Fantasy veterans Tetsuya Nomura and Kazushige Nojima in conjunction with Team Ninja and Koei Tecmo Games.
Stranger of Paradise Final Fantasy Origin appears heavy on action. In the game‚Äôs E3 2021 reveal trailer, we see a trio of Warriors of Light battling a variety of creatures and enemies, and, ultimately, the evil knight Garland from the original Final Fantasy. Square Enix‚Äôs official description of the game reads: ‚ÄúJack and his allies, Ash and Jed, burn with resolve to defeat Chaos as they throw open the gates to the Chaos Shrine. Yet doubts remain‚Äîare they truly the Warriors of Light the prophecy foretold?‚Äù
A trial version of Stranger of Paradise Final Fantasy Origin is available now from the PlayStation Store. It will be available on PlayStation 5 through June 24.
Team Ninja and Square Enix already have a close working relationship, thanks to the former‚Äôs work on Dissidia Final Fantasy NT, a fighting game featuring characters plucked from the wider Final Fantasy franchise. Square Enix previously released a game under the name Final Fantasy Origins. Released for the original PlayStation, Final Fantasy Origins compiled the first two games in the franchise in remastered form.
articles.title: Stranger of Paradise Final Fantasy Origin is a new action game from Team Ninja

articles.description:
Image: Square Enix/Twitch
    

  
From Deck Nine, True Colors is out in September
 Life is Strange: True Colors developer Deck Nine revealed more information about the game‚Äôs empathy mechanic in a presentation during publisher Square Enix‚Äôs E3 presentation Sunday. The next Life is Strange game, which is scheduled to be released on Sept. 10, is about a 21-year-old Asian American woman named Alex Chen who moves to Colorado to reunite with her brother Gabe. When her brother mysteriously dies, Alex uses her supernatural power, Empathy, to find out what happened in the quiet mountain town.
The clip shows that Alex has long struggled with these powers; she calls them a curse rather than a gift, oftentimes becoming overwhelmed by others‚Äô feelings of sadness, anger, and fear. Over the course of t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Life is Strange: True Colors shows the power of Alex‚Äôs empathy

articles.description:
Image: Square Enix/Twitch
    

  
Check out War for Wakanda in action
 Marvel‚Äôs Avengers: War for Wakanda is a new expansion coming later this year that will star Black Panther and add the Wakanda biome. Square Enix gave fans a fresh look at the expansion during its E3 2021 livestream on Sunday. 
Square Enix and Crystal Dynamics first announced the War for Wakanda expansion in March of this year. The original trailer was a call to cation from Klaw, the infamous Vibranium thief played by Andy Serkis in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Klaw and his minions will invade Wakanda in the new expansion, and the Avengers will team up with the Black Panther to help him save his kingdom.
Black Panther marks the third new hero since Marvel‚Äôs Avengers launched last year. Both Kate Bishop and Clint Barton ‚Äî two different versions of the same hero, Hawkeye ‚Äî have already made their debut. Square Enix and Crystal Dynamics previously revealed that Spider-Man will come to Marvel‚Äôs Avengers as a PlayStation-exclusive hero.
Marvel‚Äôs Avengers: War for Wakanda will be free for all players who own Marvel‚Äôs Avengers, and it will come to Google Stadia, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X. The trailer page says War for Wakanda will launch in August of this year.
articles.title: Marvel‚Äôs Avengers‚Äô Black Panther expansion gets a cinematic trailer

articles.description:
Image: Eidos-Montreal/Square Enix
    

  
It‚Äôs the first official reveal of the Marvel game, which was leaked in 2017
 Years after Eidos-Montr√©al‚Äôs Guardians of the Galaxy game was leaked in 2017, the Deus Ex developer is finally ready to show it off. Publisher Square Enix announced Guardians of the Galaxy, a single-player, third-person adventure game made in partnership with Marvel ‚Äî part of a multiple-game agreement that included Marvel‚Äôs Avengers ‚Äî during its E3 2021 presentation on Sunday. 
Guardians of the Galaxy is coming to PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X on Oct. 26.
The game draws from existing lore ‚Äî the movies and comic books ‚Äî but is a new interpretation of the gang. This is not a movie adaptation, which is quickly noticeable once you‚Äôve se‚Ä¶
articles.title: Square Enix‚Äôs Guardians of the Galaxy game lets you be Star-Lord

articles.description:
Image: Ubisoft
    


  
We got new looks at Mario + Rabbids 2, Far Cry 6, Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, and more
 E3 2021‚Äôs first of many online press conferences started Saturday with Ubisoft Forward. Based on last week‚Äôs teaser and the official event description, we‚Äôve been expecting peeks at upcoming releasee like Far Cry 6, Rainbow Six Extraction, and Riders Republic, along with updates to Assassin‚Äôs Creed Valhalla, For Honor, Watch Dogs: Legion, and The Crew 2.
Here‚Äôs a roundup of today‚Äôs biggest announcements from Ubisoft Forward E3 2021.
Rainbow 6 Extraction


We got a new look at the upcoming Rainbow 6 Extraction, the spin-off for Rainbow Six Siege‚Äôs Outbreak mode. The game was originally going to be called Rainbow Six Quarantine, but after 2020‚Äôs pandemic, Ubisoft changed the nam‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ubisoft at E3 2021: The 9 biggest announcements

articles.description:
Image: Devolver Digital
    

  
Devolver Forwarder promises wackiness
 Publisher Devolver Digital brings its singular brand of video game publisher zaniness to E3 2021 (or at least close to it) with a new livestream on Saturday, June 12. Dubbed the Devolver MaxPass+ stream, the event promises new looks at upcoming games, including gameplay for Shadow Warrior 3 and Death‚Äôs Door.
Devolver MaxPass+ (aka Devolver Forwarder) kicks off at 4:30 p.m. EDT/1:30 p.m. PDT, and will stream on Twitch. Devolver Digital promises five new game reveals from its stable of developers including Flying Wild Hog, Galvanic Games, and Doinksoft, as well as release date announcements for Phantom Abyss and Death‚Äôs Door. 
And if this year‚Äôs Devolver Digital showcase, which is unaffiliated with E3 2021, is like years past, there will be kooky, surreal, and possibly extremely gory sketches.
articles.title: Watch Devolver Digital‚Äôs not-E3 2021 showcase

articles.description:
Image: Ubisoft
    

  
New Avatar game set for 2022 release
 Ubisoft has unveiled Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, a first-person action-adventure game set in James Cameron‚Äôs Avatar universe. A new trailer highlighted the game‚Äôs central conflict, focusing on air-to-air combat between humans and the Na‚Äôvi.
First announced in February 2017, we now know the game has been built on Ubisoft‚Äôs proprietary Snowdrop Engine ‚Äî the same technology that underpins The Division. The game is being developed by Massive Entertainment, in partnership with Lightstorm Entertainment and Disney itself.
‚ÄúIn this new, standalone story,‚Äù Ubisoft says in the game‚Äôs description, ‚Äúplay as a Na‚Äôvi and embark on a journey across the Western Frontier, a never-before-seen part of Pandora. Explore a living and reactive world inhabited by unique creatures and new characters, and push back on the formidable RDA forces that threaten it.‚Äù

  
        
      Image: Ubisoft
  

  
        
      Image: Ubisoft
  

  
        
      Image: Ubisoft
  


The release window is listed a 2022. The game is being developed for PlayStation 5, Windows PC, and Xbox Series X. It will also be available on Stadia and Luna.
articles.title: Ubisoft reveals Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora with a new trailer at E3

articles.description:
Image: Ubisoft/Twitch
    

  
The Siege of Paris follows Wrath of the Druids
 Assassin‚Äôs Creed Valhalla‚Äôs developers have post-launch support planned ‚Äúwell into‚Äù the game‚Äôs second year. Highlights, announced during the Ubisoft Forward livestream on Saturday, include a story expansion called The Siege of Paris, and an educational Discovery Tour mode similar to the ones made for Assassin‚Äôs Creed Origins and Odyssey.
Ubisoft did not give a specific launch date for The Siege of Paris, other than to say it would arrive this summer. The game‚Äôs first premium expansion, The Wrath of the Druids, just launched in May. That chapter took place in Ireland; this one takes players to France for ‚Äúthe most ambitious battle in Viking history,‚Äù Ubisoft‚Äôs Karen Lee told viewers. 
The Siege of Paris is premium content, and will be available a la carte or with the game‚Äôs Season Pass. The new chapter also brings back ‚Äúblack box‚Äù missions, in which the player is given only a single infiltration objective. How they complete the task is entirely up to them.
The Viking Age Discovery Tour, like its two predecessors, will be a free update to all with the game. It‚Äôs a combat-free exploration mode and, like Assassin‚Äôs Creed Odyssey‚Äôs tour, it will allow users to create and pursue role-playing missions for the world‚Äôs inhabitants.
Assassin‚Äôs Creed: Valhalla launched in November on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, and Google‚Äôs Stadia and Amazon‚Äôs Luna services.
articles.title: Assassin‚Äôs Creed Valhalla getting a second year of content and Discovery Tour

articles.description:
Image: Ubisoft/Twitch
    

  
Siege is also getting a new Operator called Thunderbird
 Rainbow Six Siege is one of the most popular multiplayer shooters around on both console and PC and it‚Äôs finally getting cross-play ... but with some caveats. The announcement  came at Ubisoft‚Äôs E3 2021 presentation on Saturday.
On June 30, Ubisoft will add cross-play and cross-progression to Rainbow Six Siege between all of its various PC platforms including standard PC, Google Stadia, and Amazon Luna. Players from all three platforms will be able to queue into games together. For consoles, cross-play will be released in early 2022, when players on PlayStation and Xbox will be able to jump into games together. It does not appear that Ubisoft will let PC and console players compete together, which shouldn‚Äôt be much of a surprise.
Image: Ubisoft
  
According to Ubisoft‚Äôs announcement, these updates will also include cross-progression across ‚Äúall platforms‚Äù as part of one unified account, so you can earn rewards no matter where you‚Äôre playing. 


Right after the announcement of cross-play and cross-progression, Ubisoft also gave fans a new look at the game‚Äôs newest Defensive Operator, Thunderbird. The Thunderbird preview came in the form of an gorgeous animated trailer where the new Operator takes on a bear with a flare gun and lives to tell the tale. 
Thunderbird will be available as part of Siege‚Äôs North Star update and event, which starts next week on June 14.
articles.title: Rainbow Six Siege is finally getting cross-play and cross-progression

articles.description:
Image: Ubisoft
    

  
Ubisoft announces Vaas, Pagan, and Joseph as playable characters
 Far Cry 6‚Äôs season pass will add three villains from previous Far Cry games as playable characters, Ubisoft announced at its E3 2021 press conference Saturday. As seen in the trailer above, Vaas Montenegro from Far Cry 3, Pagan Min from Far Cry 4, and Joseph Seed from Far Cry 5 will be playable characters in post-release content for Far Cry 6.
The content appears dreamlike or hallucinogenic in nature, giving Ubisoft a narrative out for its Far Cry 6 DLC. Not that it‚Äôs ever really needed one; Far Cry 3 went full weird with its Blood Dragon DLC and Far Cry 5‚Äôs post-release content had players fighting zombies and Martian monsters, after all.
The season pass content also includes Far Cry 3‚Äôs DLC Blood Dragon.
The revelation that Vaas, Pagan, and Joseph will return for Far Cry 6 certainly helps make sense of a tease from actor Michael Mando, the face and voice of Vaas, who said in 2020, ‚ÄúVaas is my spirit animal - having co-created that character is something that will always be dear to me. I still get recognized as Vaas, and I still feel the outpouring of love for that character - makes me very happy. Who knows... maybe I will reprise the role very soon?‚Äù
Far Cry 6, by Ubisoft Toronto, launches Oct. 7 on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X, and Google‚Äôs Stadia and Amazon‚Äôs Luna platforms. The game stars Giancarlo Esposito as the primary antagonist; he is El Presidente, Anton Castillo, the autocratic ruler determined to crush an uprising bent on regime change. Our preview from two weeks ago has more.
Update: This story has been updated with confirmation from Ubisoft.
articles.title: Far Cry 6 will let you play as past villains in DLC

articles.description:
Image: Ubisoft Toronto/Ubisoft
    

  
Season Pass owners can add Aiden Pearce and Wrench to their DedSec cells
 Watch Dogs: Legion ‚Äî Bloodline, the story expansion for those who bought the game‚Äôs premium season pass, will launch July 6, Ubisoft said on Saturday. The story brings back Aiden Pearce from the first Watch Dogs and Wrench from the second as playable characters.
Pearce, according to Ubisoft‚Äôs news release, has come to London to reconnect with his nephew, Jackson. He‚Äôs supposed to infiltrate a Broca Tech lab and steal some cutting edge technology ‚Äî but Wrench gets the device first and flees. With his job botched, Pearce and his nephew are now on the lam from those who hired him.
Ubisoft‚Äôs statement says Bloodline is a prequel to the main campaign of Watch Dogs: Legion. It will also offer several side quests for both characters to complete.
Watch Dogs: Legion ‚Äî Bloodline is available a la carte for $14.99 to those without the Season Pass. The Season Pass, $29.99 if you didn‚Äôt get it with one of two premium editions in the game‚Äôs October 2020 launch, lets players add Aiden Pearce and Wrench to their DedSec Resistance club, whether in the single-player tour or the multiplayer Watch Dogs: Legion Online mode that launched in March.
Watch Dogs: Legion launched Oct. 29 for Google Stadia, PlayStation 4, Windows PC, Xbox One, with versions for Amazon‚Äôs Luna service, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X added later.
Post-launch content, both free and premium, was delayed both by development challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic and other glitches and fixes necessary in the main game. The first piece of premium Season Pass content, which launched in early May, included a new mission for the single-player campaign and special playable operative. On June 1, Ubisoft Toronto released a new, free mode for the PC version of the game, Watch Dogs: Legion of the Dead, which pits online players against a zombie horde.
articles.title: Watch Dogs: Legion‚Äôs first premium expansion, Bloodline, launches in July

articles.description:
Image: Ubisoft/Twitch
    

  
Tactical alien action with Rainbow Six operators
 Rainbow Six is getting back to its tactical co-op roots, sort of. The newest entry in the series is Rainbow Six Extraction and it will pit players against hordes of mutated aliens, but ... tactically. The game‚Äôs latest footage was shown on Saturday during Ubisoft‚Äôs E3 2021 presentation. 
The trailer starts off by giving us a bit of background on where the alien nightmare came from. An asteroid crashes to Earth and starts infecting people all around the world. The trailer then follows a small squad of special ops soldiers from around the world as they try to extra one of their own from the hands of the aliens. Things seem to be going well, before the squad gets ambushed by an Apex and a few other special aliens that seem more dangerous than the rest. 


Rainbow Six Extraction was originally announced in 2019 as a spin-off for Rainbow Six Siege‚Äôs Outbreak mode, a co-op mode where players fought through hordes of mutant AI enemies ‚Äî instead of the series‚Äô usual vague terrorists. The game was also originally going to be called Rainbow Six Quarantine, but after 2020‚Äôs pandemic, Ubisoft changed the name to Extraction. Extraction is developed by a new team at Ubisoft Montreal. 
Just like Outbreak, the new Rainbow Six game blends the series‚Äô tactical slow-paced roots with the character-based action of the Rainbow Six Siege. Extraction will let players hunt down ‚Äî or escape from ‚Äî infected aliens together as a squad of up to three, similar to the earliest games in the series, but will let players do this while playing as the unique Operators that players already know and love from Siege ‚Äî including characters like Ela, Ash, and Hibana.  
Rainbow Six Extraction is set to be released on  is set to be released on Sept. 16 on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X. The game will also include cross-play, letting players squad up across different platforms.
articles.title: Rainbow Six Extraction looks like Tom Clancy‚Äôs Aliens, coming Sept. 16

articles.description:
Image: Gearbox Software/2K Games
    

  
Gearbox has Tiny Tina‚Äôs Wonderlands, a Borderlands movie, and more in store
 Borderlands developer Gearbox Software is heading to E3 2021 armed with a new game, Tiny Tina‚Äôs Wonderlands ‚Äî the high-fantasy spinoff of its shooter-looter series ‚Äî and a new movie. Gearbox fans expect to hear more about Borderlands ‚Äî the Eli Roth-directed movie starring Cate Blanchett, Kevin Hart, Jack Black, and Jamie Lee Curtis ‚Äî during its E3 Showcase on Saturday.
Gearbox Entertainment will take over the official E3 2021 livestream on Saturday, June 12 at 5 p.m. EDT/2 p.m. PDT. The event, which is expected to run about 30 minutes, will stream on E3‚Äôs YouTube, Twitch, Facebook, and Twitter channels.
Beyond Wonderlands and Borderlands, don‚Äôt be surprised if a few Gearbox Publishing titles also get some attention during Gearbox‚Äôs E3 showcase. Norsfell and Gearbox announced earlier this week that co-op action survival RPG Tribes of Midgard will launch July 27 on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and Windows PC via Steam.
For the full E3 2021 calendar, check out Polygon‚Äôs complete streaming schedule of E3 events.
articles.title: How to watch Gearbox‚Äôs E3 2021 showcase

articles.description:
Rocksmith 2014, for PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. | Image: Ubisoft San Francisco/Ubisoft
    

  
Registration for PC beta begins today
 Ubisoft‚Äôs 10-year-old Rocksmith franchise will become an ‚Äúinteractive music learning subscription service,‚Äù with its next entry, Rocksmith Plus. That‚Äôs according to an email that guitar maker Gibson let slip before Ubisoft could announce the video game at its E3 keynote on Saturday.
Per the marketing email, Ubisoft is apparently partnering with Gibson again, as the company‚Äôs Epiphone, Kramer, and Gibson models of acoustic, electric, or bass guitars are specifically mentioned as compatible. A closed beta on PC will also begin soon, with registration open today.
Image: Gibson via Ubisoft
      A gif included with the email Gibson sent today.
  
Newcomers and returning musicians will find ‚Äúan expansive library‚Äù of songs in Rocksmith Plus‚Äôs catalog. The program‚Äôs Riff Repeater, which can control a song‚Äôs speed to help players practice, also returns.
The first Rocksmith launched in 2011 but only for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3. That was followed two years later by Rocksmith 2014, considered a replacement rather than a sequel. That game launched for PC platforms in addition to the two consoles, and their successors.
Rocksmith 2014‚Äôs song library included 66 playable tracks on the disc, with more available as downloadable content. Saturday‚Äôs email did not specify how many songs would be available with the base game, or how deep the subscription service runs, or its pricing, for that matter.
Update: Ubisoft formally announced Rocksmith Plus at Saturday‚Äôs Ubisoft Forward event. The game still does not have a release date. During a presentation, Ubisoft said Rocksmith Plus players will also be able to use something called Rocksmith Workshop to create and add their own guitar arrangements to the game.
articles.title: Rocksmith Plus coming soon, billed as a subscription service

articles.description:
Image: Velan Studios/Electronic Arts
    

  
The sport is only two weeks old, but it already has hustlers and sandbaggers
 Barely two weeks into its launch and Knockout City already has hustlers.
Karthik Bala, co-founder of the studio that developed the multiplayer shooter-like dodgeball title for Electronic Arts, said he‚Äôs run into them himself. ‚ÄúThey were messing with me,‚Äù he laughed. ‚ÄúThey come in, they look like one of the default [skins] on startup, they play poorly, they‚Äôre uncoordinated as a team, they‚Äôre purposefully not on a crew together.‚Äù
After stumbling to a 7-to-1 deficit early in Team KO, then they poured it on. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm like, ‚ÄòI‚Äôve got this game lit,‚Äô‚Äù Bala chortled. ‚ÄúAnd then all of a sudden it just flipped; and they do the ‚Äòwoo-hoo!‚Äô and the taunts. And I‚Äôm like, what just ha‚Ä¶
articles.title: Knockout City draws a crowd, and dodgeball sharks are working it

articles.description:
Photo by CHARLY TRIBALLEAU/AFP via Getty Images
    

  
Halo, Starfield, Fable, and Game Pass news
 Microsoft‚Äôs E3 2021 press conference ‚Äî called the Xbox & Bethesda Games Showcase ‚Äî has a lot of ground to cover on June 13. The company has more to reveal for long-delayed Halo Infinite, including hopefully a finalized release date. It will also likely have updates to the Fable and Forza franchises, and Rare will likely have updates to Sea of Thieves and hopefully more to say on its mystical title Everwild. 
The Xbox & Bethesda Games Showcase will stream on Twitch, YouTube, Facebook, and Twitter at 1 p.m. EDT/10 a.m. PDT, and last for about 90 minutes. 
This is the first E3 since Microsoft acquired Bethesda, so the publisher and its studios will also take part in the press conference. Expect updates on long-awaited Starfield, and maybe a better look at The Elder Scrolls 6. Bethesda also promised updates to Fallout 76. 
Ahead of E3, Microsoft revealed plans to bring Xbox Game Pass and streaming games to internet-capable TVs and other stand-alone platforms, as well as bringing cloud based gaming to iOS devices. Microsoft also committed to bring at least one new first-party Xbox Game Studios game to Game Pass every quarter.
articles.title: Xbox and Bethesda E3 2021 press conference: News, announcements, trailers from the event

articles.description:
Attendees line up at the doors to the Los Angeles Convention Center for the first day of E3 2019, the most recent in-person E3. | Photo by Charley Gallay/Getty Images for E3/Entertainment Software Association
    

  
Elden Ring leads the list at 2021‚Äôs latest-and-greatest showcase
 E3 2021 means game trailers and video highlights by the dozen. By the score. By the gross. We‚Äôll do our best to catalogue here all of the reveals and demonstrations coming from a week of presentations and keynotes.
We already got a slew of new looks at big games during the two-hour Summer Game Fest Kickoff Live on Thursday. That will be followed by major publishers Ubisoft, Square Enix, and Bethesda and Microsoft over the weekend. Nintendo‚Äôs highly anticipated E3 2021 Nintendo Direct on Tuesday caps the big week.
Here are all the game trailers for E3 2021; check back frequently, this list will be updated.
articles.title: E3 2021 trailers: The best and biggest new games shown this week

articles.description:
Image: Ember Lab
    


  
Kena blends multiple genres into something new
 Kena: Bridge of Spirits is the first game from new studio Ember Lab. Its first trailer made it look like a cute romp through a forest overtaken by darkness, but after spending over an hour with a hands-on demo of Kena: Bridge of Spirits, I‚Äôve learned it‚Äôs surprisingly difficult. Kena may look like the latest from Pixar, but the final mini-boss I encountered kicked my ass up, down, and sideways.
Kena: Bridge of Spirits has layers to it ‚Äî some cute, others tough ‚Äî and it made for a fun preview full of surprises.
What is Kena: Bridge of Spirits?

  
        
      Image: Ember Lab
      Teleporting, monkey-like enemies tested me after I picked up the bow
  

Kena: Bridge of Spirits is a character action game with a clo‚Ä¶
articles.title: Kena: Bridge of Spirits evokes God of War with a dose of Pikmin

articles.description:
Image: Bungie
    

  
This week you can pick up three weapons and an armor piece
 Trials of Osiris is back in Destiny 2. Saint-14 is the new Trials vendor and announcer, and players can find him and his wares in the Tower Hangar every Friday at reset.
Each week, the Trials of Osiris map changes, as do the rewards for winning a certain number of matches. The rewards are consistent across all players, although each player‚Äôs weapon roll will differ.
Here are the guaranteed Trials of Osiris rewards this week.
Map: The Burnout
3 wins ‚Äî Eye of Sol, Kinetic sniper rifle
5 wins ‚Äî The Messenger, Kinetic pulse rifle
7 wins ‚Äî Pyrrhic Ascent Grasps, Gauntlets, Gloves (Hunter, Titan, Warlock)
Flawless ‚Äî Igneous Hammer (Adept), Solar hand cannon
Note: As of Season of Arrivals, players can complete the End Game weekly bounty ‚Äî which just needs Trials match completions (wins give more progress) ‚Äî to earn the three-win reward.
Players who manage to reach seven wins without a single loss can go to the Lighthouse social space ‚Äî this is called a Flawless run. The Lighthouse offers additional rewards for players, some of which are unique, like a special emblem. 
Players who reach the Lighthouse also earn a special armor glow for any of their Trials of Osiris armor, which lasts for the remainder of the weekend.
articles.title: Destiny 2 Trials of Osiris rewards, June 11-15

articles.description:
Ubisoft‚Äôs booth at E3 2019, the last in-person expo.  E3 should return to the Los Angeles Convention Center for the 2022 event. | Photo by Charley Gallay/Getty Images for E3/Entertainment Software Association
    

  
Check back for the latest trailers and reveals
 E3 2021 is again a fully online event, but that hasn‚Äôt held back video game publishers and developers from unleashing their usual torrent of trailers, premieres and announcements. We‚Äôre rounding up all the news from video gaming‚Äôs biggest week here, and we‚Äôll be updating it as more news comes in.
Highlights for this week‚Äôs schedule of events, all of which may be viewed online:
SATURDAY, JUNE 12

Ubisoft Forward is 3 p.m. EDT/noon PDT.

SUNDAY, JUNE 13
The Xbox & Bethesda Games Showcase is 1 p.m. EDT/10 a.m. PDT.
Square Enix Presents is 3:15 p.m. EDT/12:15 p.m. PDT.

Warner Bros. Games‚Äô showcase is 5 p.m. EDT/2 p.m. PDT.

The PC Gaming Show is 5:30 p.m. EDT/2:30 p.m. PDT.


MONDAY, JUNE 14
Take-Two Interactive (2K Games, 2K Sports, Rockstar Games) has a panel at 1:15 p.m. EDT/10:15 a.m. PDT.
Capcom‚Äôs news conference is 5:30 p.m. EDT/2:30 p.m. PDT.


TUESDAY, JUNE 15
Nintendo‚Äôs E3 2021 Nintendo Direct is 12 p.m. EDT/9 a.m. PDT.

Bandai Namco has an E3 presentation at 5:25 p.m. EDT/2:25 p.m. PDT.

The E3 2021 Awards Show is 7:45 p.m. EDT/4:45 p.m. PDT
Note: Neither Sony/PlayStation nor Electronic Arts have E3 week events planned. Electronic Arts‚Äô EA Play event is scheduled for Thursday, July 22.
articles.title: E3 2021: All the news, announcements, and updates from video games‚Äô biggest week

articles.description:
Image: Bungie
    

  
Head to the Tower for some Exotics
 The weekly Exotic item merchant, Xur, hangs out in random locations around the world of Destiny. In Destiny 2, he can appear all over the map, as well as inside the Tower. This week, you can find Xur in the Tower, hanging out by the back stairs in the Hangar.
Image: Bungie via Polygon
  
Xur‚Äôs inventory this week consists of the following:
Two-Tailed fox, rocket launcher: 29 Legendary Shards
St0mp-EE5, Hunter legs: 23 Legendary Shards
Severance Enclosure, Titan chest: 23 Legendary Shards
Chromatic Fire, Warlock chest: 23 Legendary Shards
Exotic Engram: 97 Legendary Shards (you can now purchase a second with an Exotic Cipher)
Exotic Cipher quest: free


Xur‚Äôs items drop at a similar power level as your character.
Two-Tailed Fox
The ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Destiny 2 Xur location and items, June 11-15

articles.description:
Image: FromSoftware/Bandai Namco
    

  
Ceramics will have their revenge
 FromSoftware‚Äôs Elden Ring finally came out of hiding on Thursday, after two years of deafening silence about the new adventure from Hidetaka Miyazaki and George R.R. Martin. It looked spectacular, in a next-gen Dark Souls kind of way, with its gigantic lightning-chucking dragons, double-jumping horses, a spider made of fingers, a brand-new Tall Lady to obsess over, and, of course, those pots.
Oh, those pots.
Elden Ring‚Äôs first gameplay trailer barely hinted at the existence of anthropomorphic pots, but they‚Äôve becoming a quiet sensation since they were revealed. It seems everyone ‚Äî there are dozens of us! ‚Äî loves the little pot with arms and legs, and the slightly larger pot with arms and legs. In case you blacked ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Everyone loves Elden Ring‚Äôs cute pot boys

articles.description:
Photo: Bloomberg via Getty Images
    

  
Security breach was reportedly performed via EA‚Äôs Slack
 A group of hackers has said they‚Äôve broken into The Sims 4 and FIFA publisher Electronic Arts‚Äô internal systems, according to a report from Vice. Hackers reportedly stole FIFA 21 source code ‚Äî for the game and its matchmaking components ‚Äî as well as source code for EA‚Äôs Frostbite engine.
A total of 780 GB of data stolen was stolen, Vice reported, including ‚Äúproprietary EA frameworks and software development kits.‚Äù Hackers provided Vice with documents reportedly stolen in the hack, with information on PlayStation VR and other development tools.
‚ÄúWe are investigating a recent incident of intrusion into our network where a limited amount of game source code and related tools were stolen,‚Äù an EA representative told Vice. ‚ÄúNo player data was accessed, and we have no reason to believe there is any risk to player privacy. Following the incident, we‚Äôve already made security improvements and do not expect an impact on our games or our business. We are actively working with law enforcement officials and other experts as part of this ongoing criminal investigation.‚Äù
Hackers reportedly accessed EA‚Äôs internal systems through workplace chat platform Slack, which plenty of companies use for online communication. The hackers told Vice they obtained access to an EA Slack channel using ‚Äústolen cookies‚Äù sold online for $10. (Cookies can be used to access login details.)
The hackers said they contacted an EA IT support person via Slack for a ‚Äúmultifactor authentication token‚Äù ‚Äî claiming they‚Äôd lost their phone ‚Äî to login to EA‚Äôs network. The hackers provided Vice with screenshots of the steps taken in accessing the information; Vice later confirmed the details of the hack with EA.
Contents of the hack have not been released online, at least just yet. Vice reported that the hackers are looking to sell the data.
EA has not responded to Polygon‚Äôs request for more information.
articles.title: Hackers say they‚Äôve stolen FIFA and Frostbite source code in EA breach

articles.description:
Image: Starbreeze Studios
    

  
Koch Media unveils new publishing label
 The next Payday game from Starbreeze Studios and a brand-new Painkiller are coming from a newly announced game publishing label called Prime Matter. Koch Media, which also owns publishing labels Deep Silver, Milestone, and Ravenscourt, announced Prime Matter on Thursday, revealing its first slate of games.
Koch Media calls Prime Matter a ‚Äúpremium label‚Äù that‚Äôs ‚Äúdedicated to delivering brilliant immersive games.‚Äù That includes soon-to-be-released titles like Encased from Dark Crystal Games and King‚Äôs Bounty 2 by 1C Entertainment, both of which are due in the coming months. Then there are games that won‚Äôt be out for years, including Payday 3 and a new Painkiller game from Saber Interactive. 
In between, Prime Matter will publish Crossfire: Legion, a new real-time strategy game from Blackbird Interactive based on Smilegate‚Äôs Crossfire shooter series; GunGrave GORE, developer Iggymob‚Äôs anime-inspired third-person action shooter; and Kingdom Come Deliverance for Nintendo Switch. 
Prime Matter will also publish dark sci-fi action adventure Scars Above, futuristic FPS Codename Final Form, Lovecraftian horror action RPG Dolmen, Middle Ages-era action RPG The Last Oricru, story-driven fantasy adventure Echoes Of The End, and psychedelic horror adventure The Chant.
For a peek at many of those games, check out Prime Matter‚Äôs sizzle reel below.
articles.title: Payday 3, new Painkiller coming from new label Prime Matter

articles.description:
Image: Summer Game Fest 2021
    

  
Fight Deadites with three friends (and one frenemy)
 On Thursday at the Summer Game Fest, we got our first look at the gameplay of Evil Dead: The Game, an upcoming co-op shooter. Four players choose their characters from the cast of the Evil Dead franchise, and then move as a team through towns, woods, and creepy cabins. A breach between worlds has opened, summoning monsters to deal with.
One player gets to take on the role of the antagonist, a Kandarian Demon; they‚Äôre tasked with hunting down everyone else in the game. The demon can possess the good guys, manipulate the environment, and fly. It‚Äôll be a constant concern throughout a match, especially if it‚Äôs controlled by a skilled player.
While moving through the environment, players have the opportunity to loot and craft. It‚Äôll also be necessary to actively manage your player character‚Äôs fear. If they get too scared, they can actually die, which is pretty alarming in and of itself. Once players find the necessary items, like pages of the Necronomicon, they can turn the tables on the Kandarian Demon. It looks a little like Dead by Daylight, if the survivors had the ability to fight back.
Evil Dead: The Game will be released for PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X.
articles.title: Evil Dead: The Game is a 4v1 shooter full of camp and gore

articles.description:
Image: Summer Game Fest 2021
    

  
The trailer shows a tragic backdrop to a tranquil scene
 Planet of Lana is a beautiful new cinematic puzzle adventure game from the Swedish indie studio, Wishfully. It was announced during Summer Games Fest kick-off event on Thursday.
The story follows Lana, and her animal companion as they embark on a mission to save Lana‚Äôs sister. Their planet ‚Äî which used to be a place in perfect harmony between human, nature ‚Äî has fallen into chaos and now must endure a faceless army.
What‚Äôs interesting though, is that this game expressly isn‚Äôt about war or conflict. ‚ÄúThis is a story about a vibrant, beautiful planet ‚Äìand the journey to keep it that way,‚Äù a description from the developers said. 
The world in Planet of Lana looks stunning. From what we saw in the trailer, the game boasts stunning hand-painted graphics and a Miyazaki-esque world. 
A release shared that the visual style ‚Äúcombines hand-drawn artwork, complex parallax layering and subtle use of 3D graphics to give the look of an interactive painting.‚Äù The game will run on high-end PCs and the Xbox Series X with a native resolution of 4K at 60 frames per second, ‚Äúallowing its incredible artwork to come to life.‚Äù
In the trailer, we see a young woman, Lana, embrace a cute and chirpy black creature. The opening scene is tranquil. There‚Äôs a large moon in the background, a gentle breeze blowing the tall grass, and you can hear birds in the background. 
However, as the camera zooms out we see what looks to be dozens of rockets fast approaching the planet. It‚Äôs a grim, but captivating juxtaposition that introduces us to its new world. 
Planet of Lana is slated to come out in 2022 to PC Windows, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X in late 2022.
articles.title: Planet of Lana is a stunning hand-painted adventure

articles.description:
Image: FromSoftware/Bandai Namco
    

  
FromSoftware and George R.R. Martin‚Äôs long-awaited game arrives in 2022
 Elden Ring, the long-awaited new game from Dark Souls developer FromSoftware, has finally come out of hiding. Publisher Bandai Namco gave fans a new look at the epic fantasy role-playing game during Thursday‚Äôs Summer Game Fest Kickoff Live stream.
The new trailer for Elden Ring showed gameplay for the first time, gameplay that will look very familiar to fans of Dark Souls, Bloodborne, and Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice. We also got a release date ‚Äî Jan. 21, 2022 ‚Äî and platforms. Elden Ring is coming to current-gen and last-gen consoles, as well as PC.
Elden Ring appears to have many elements familiar to Dark Souls players: swords and sorcery, summonable allies, and giant mythical monsters to battle. But it also has something fans of FromSoftware aren‚Äôt accustomed to: horses!
Check out new 4K images of Elden Ring in the gallery below.


The last time we heard anything about Elden Ring was in June 2019, when Bandai Namco and FromSoftware officially revealed the game. Elden Ring was pitched at that year‚Äôs E3 as FromSoftware‚Äôs ‚Äúlargest game to-date,‚Äù and is said to be set in a ‚Äúsprawling realm steeped in a rich and bloody history‚Äù crafted by Dark Souls creator Hidetaka Miyazaki and Game of Thrones creator George R.R. Martin.
Miyazaki has said that Elden Ring will be ‚Äúfull of things that we weren‚Äôt able to do in the Dark Souls series.‚Äù The game will focus ‚Äúmore heavily on RPG elements,‚Äù Miyazaki said in an interview from 2019, and ‚Äúwill include a wide variety of weapons, magic, and ways to engage enemies, that make it possible to provide users with a style of gameplay and strategy that suits them.‚Äù
FromSoftware fans have since been wracked with Elden Ring-information withdrawal, leading the community to fill the void with its own, self-created lore.
Elden Ring is coming to PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X next year.
articles.title: Elden Ring resurfaces in new trailer, release date announced

articles.description:
Image: Summer Game Fest 2021
    

  
Less Masquerade, more mass murdering
 Developer Sharkmob is creating a new game in the Vampire: the Masquerade universe, but it‚Äôs a far cry from the dialogue-heavy RPGs that are common to the franchise. Instead, this is an action-packed battle royale game with swords, shotguns, and sniper rifles. At the Summer Game Fest on Thursday, Sharkmob showed off the game in more detail. The title was originally teased in fall 2020, but it finally has a name: Bloodhunt.
We saw some in-engine alpha footage of urban environments, including graveyards and nightclubs. The trailer also showed vampires from different clans, like Brujah and Nosferatu vampires in the street. Players will get to pick their clan, which will determine their playstyle. It also looks as though civilians factor into this game in a significant way, and vampires may be able to feed on them for a little boost. 
There‚Äôs an array of ways to go about, well, the battle in this battle royale. Some characters rely on weapons and explosives, while others augment their gunplay with powerful supernatural abilities like blinking through space or putting up blinding shields of light.
Bloodhunt is set to be released on PC in 2021. Players can sign up for a closed alpha test on the game‚Äôs official website.
articles.title: Bloodhunt is an upcoming Vampire: the Masquerade battle royale

articles.description:
Image: CD Projekt Red
    

  
‚ÄòWe cannot confirm whether or not the data involved may have been manipulated or tampered with‚Äô
 CD Projekt, the parent company of the developer of Cyberpunk 2077, announced Thursday that the data breach it suffered earlier this year is potentially more damaging than originally thought. The news was announced during the high-profile industry premieres showcased during the Summer Game Fest, hosted by Geoff Keighley.
In early February CD Project announced that it was targeted by a ‚Äúcyber attack‚Äù and that data, including video game source code, had been stolen. At the time, the Polish company said that ‚Äúcertain data‚Äù was being ransomed by unknown parties. It did not confirm the type of data stolen. Today‚Äôs announcement, while still vague, seems to indicate that ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Cyberpunk 2077 publisher CD Projekt says data breach is worse than originally thought

articles.description:
Image: Summer Game Fest 2021
    

  
The Frontier Developments game will come out in 2021
 At Summer Game Fest on Thursday, actor Jeff Goldblum announced Frontier‚Äôs newest game, Jurassic World Evolution 2. The new title is the follow-up to the park-building sim released in 2018, Jurassic World Evolution, and it is slated to be released in 2021 for PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Windows PC, and Xbox One. 
Goldblum had the honor of announcing the release, since he will play Dr. Ian Malcolm in the upcoming game, and has played Dr. Malcolm in the Jurassic Park film canon, and in games like The Lost World: Jurassic Park and Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom. He will be joined by the actress Bryce Dallas Howard who will play Claire Dearing in the game.
The new campaign in Jurassic Wo‚Ä¶
articles.title: Jeff Goldblum announces Jurassic World Evolution 2

articles.description:
Huge beasts and what to call them, the answers will be slowly dripped out in The Anacrusis‚Äô dialogue and in-world objects, as opposed to a narrative with formal cutscenes. | Image: Stray Bombay Company
    


  
An AI ‚ÄòDriver‚Äô similar to L4D‚Äôs Director will make or break Chet Faliszek‚Äôs newest game
 Chet Faliszek won‚Äôt begrudge you for thinking his newest game sounds a lot like one of his old ones. The Anacrusis, coming this fall to Windows PC via Steam, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X on Xbox Game Pass, is a cooperative shooter in which four players must fight together against a relentless horde of mindless monsters. 
So, that‚Äôs basically Left 4 Dead, right?
‚ÄúFirst, I love Left 4 Dead, so, any mention of that is fine,‚Äù said Faliszek, Valve‚Äôs project leader and lead writer for the 2008 game an‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Anacrusis looks like Left 4 Dead aboard a groovy ‚Äô70s spaceship

articles.description:
Image: Summer Game Fest 2021
    

  
Plus, two new roles: the Sherriff and the Scientist
 Among Us‚Äô next update got partially revealed during the Summer Game Fest livestream on Thursday, and it includes a new map, new colors and cosmetics, new roles, and a Hide and Seek mode. There‚Äôs no release date for this new content yet, and the only part of the map we got to see was one tiny environmental asset.
The new roles are the Sherriff and the Scientist. In the genre of hidden role games like Among Us, these roles are often used to give the civilians more power against hidden monsters. The Sherriff may be able to take an Impostor out without gaining consensus, and a Scientist may be able to test blood types. We‚Äôll have to see how these new roles fit into the current crewmate/impostor dynamic.
There are also some other nice touches incoming: new visor cosmetics, new crewmate colors, and achievements.
Among Us was released in 2018, but the game saw a massive boost in popularity during the summer of 2020. The social deception game pits crewmates against disguised impostors. If the impostors manage to covertly kill all of the crewmates, they win, but if the crewmates can ferret out the impostors, then they win. It‚Äôs a simple concept that plays out very well, especially on streams. The game has maintained a steady fandom since 2020, and it‚Äôs still solidly part of the pop culture zeitgeist.
articles.title: Among Us gets Hide and Seek, new map in next update

articles.description:
Image: Battlestate Games
    

  
The popular game remains in an extended beta period
 Battlestate Games, the developer behind the hardcore survival shooter Escape From Tarkov, is teasing a new map called Streets of Tarkov. A new residential section was shown Thursday during the Summer Game Fest hosted by Geoff Keighley. The trailer also introduced a fully functional armored personnel carrier.
Tarkov is a session-based game first announced in 2016. In it, players take on the role of private military contractors trapped in an isolated Eastern European war zone. Caught in between are the scavs, a lightly armed group of civilians fighting for survival. Tarkov is unique for a number of reasons, including its sophisticated ballistics model and its high-stakes, winner-takes-all looting mechanics‚Ä¶
articles.title: Escape From Tarkov dev teases new urban map and a deadly armored vehicle

articles.description:
Image: Treyarch/Activision
    

  
The new trailer also teases another update for Verdansk
 Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War and Warzone are getting another new season, but there won‚Äôt be a whole new map this time. We got a preview of the season‚Äôs changes during the Summer Games Fest event on Thursday, where Treyarch unveiled a new trailer for the update.
The largest Warzone-exclusive change seems to be the new updates coming to the time-warped Verdansk. It seems that a satellite has crashed onto the map, destroyed several buildings and leaving its wreckage strewn across the map. 
Meanwhile, on the Black Ops Cold War side of things, we got a glimpse of several new maps including Collateral, the 2v2 Amsterdam, and Hijacked, a remake of a Black Ops 3 map. The trailer also gave a few hints at what‚Äôs next for the Zombies mode. It seems there are a few new huge enemies on the way including something that looked like a dragon, and a new flaming train. One thing that wasn‚Äôt clear is which of these updates will arrive for Outbreak and which will be a new round-based map. 
Call of Duty: Warzone‚Äôs previous season involved a massive map change and a midseason patch that included an action movie event starring John McClane and John Rambo. While this patch certainly seems to be smaller than that, it does seem like it will have plenty of new additions to the game for players to check out over the next few months. 
Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War and Warzone season 4 will start on June 17.
articles.title: Call of Duty: Warzone and Black Ops Cold War season 4 will bring back the Hijacked map

articles.description:
Hello! I‚Äôm very slowly
working on writing a zine about debugging, so I asked on Twitter the other day:
If you‚Äôve run into a bug where it felt ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù to understand what was happening ‚Äì what made it feel that way?
Of course, bugs always happen for logical reasons, but I‚Äôve definitely run into
bugs that felt like they might be impossible for me to understand (until I
figured them out!)
I got about 400 responses, which I‚Äôll try to summarize here. I‚Äôm not going to
talk about how to deal with these various kinds of ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù bugs in this
post, I‚Äôll just try to classify them.
Here are the categories I came up with for ways a bug might feel impossible
to understand. Each one of them has a bunch of sub variants which are bolded below.
it‚Äôs hard to reproduce
you don‚Äôt understand the overall‚Ä¶
articles.title: Reasons why bugs might feel "impossible"

articles.description:
Hey,
this week I want to share thoughts from Jens Oliver Meiert on ¬ªListening¬´ with you. I wholeheartedly agree with the point raised in the text that we are at a point where we don‚Äôt listen to others anymore, where we disagree or dismiss other people‚Äôs ideas straight without reconsidering them, without trying to understand the standpoint. It‚Äôs either 100% or 0%. But there are so many goodies if we change this habit that we should exercise the practise of listening and understanding other opinions again. When reading, I realise that I‚Äôm trying my best already, I realise that I wish more people would be more open but I also realise that I struggle with it quite regularly, too. So I‚Äôll promise to myself now again to do my best to get better at not dismissing other opinions straight away.
New‚Ä¶
articles.title: WDRL ‚Äî Edition 289: Simplify your life and work and new stuff on the web

articles.description:
Hey,
it‚Äôs been a long while and I‚Äôll start with a big sorry to all my loyal readers over the past years. I‚Äôve neglected this project since January this year and just now found enough time to bring it back to life. Why to life? Because I broke my setup in January and then went the bigger upgrade path and had to update and partially refactor my entire custom software for the newsletter. I‚Äôm now using Kirby 3 (previously v2) for the project together with my browser web extension to save links into my draft editions. I also switched to use TailwindCSS to understand the concept a bit better and have to say it definitely is worth it. It‚Äôs probably not the most suitable solution for this kind of project but for bigger projects in a team with many devs or if a website has to be built on a budget i‚Ä¶
articles.title: WDRL ‚Äî Edition 288: Back again with Kirby 3 and some fresh content for you

articles.description:
In 1715, a significant chunk of Rembrandt‚Äôs masterpiece The Night Watch, including a 2-foot-wide swath from the left side of the painting, was lopped off in order to fit the painting in a smaller space. (WTF?!) Using a contemporary copy of the full scene painted by Gerrit Lundens and an AI program for getting the colors and angles right, the Rijksmuseum has ‚Äúrestored‚Äù The Night Watch, augmenting the painting with digital printouts of the missing bits. The uncropped Rembrandt is shown above and here is Lundens‚Äôs version:

I‚Äôm not an expert on art, but the 1715 crop and the shift of the principal characters from right-of-center to the center appears to have radically altered the whole feel of the painting.
With the addition especially on the left and the bottom, an empty space is created in the painting where they march towards. When the painting was cut [the lieutenants] were in the centre, but Rembrandt intended them to be off-centre marching towards that empty space, and that is the genius that Rembrandt understands: you create movement, a dynamic of the troops marching towards the left of the painting.


(via @john_overholt)
Tags: art¬†¬† artificial intelligence¬†¬† Gerrit Lundens¬†¬† Rembrandt
articles.title: A Rembrandt Masterpiece Uncropped by AI

articles.description:
In just over two hours, this video presents 1540 paintings by impressionist master Claude Monet, a significant portion of his lifetime output. This is a really intriguing way to look at art. It‚Äôs not in-person and you don‚Äôt get a lot of time with each piece, but the video is HD, you can pause or slow the playback speed, and by seeing a lot of work over a short span of time, you can get a real sense of the stylistic choices and variations across Monet‚Äôs oeuvre ‚Äî a view of the forest rather than the trees. (via open culture)
Tags: art¬†¬† Claude Monet¬†¬† video
articles.title: See 1540 Paintings by Claude Monet in Two Hours

articles.description:
The US Postal Service has released a set of Sun Science stamps that use images from NASA‚Äôs Solar Dynamics Observatory to illustrate different solar phenomena like plasma blasts, sunspots, and solar flares.
Printed with a foil treatment that adds a glimmer to the stamps, the images on these stamps come from NASA‚Äôs Solar Dynamics Observatory, a spacecraft launched in February 2010 to keep a constant watch on the sun from geosynchronous orbit above Earth. The striking colors in these images do not represent the actual colors of the sun as perceived by human eyesight. Instead, each image is colorized by NASA according to different wavelengths that reveal or highlight specific features of the sun‚Äôs activity.
One of the stamps highlights sunspots, two feature images of coronal holes, two show coronal loops, two depict plasma blasts, one is a view of an active sun that emphasizes its magnetic fields, and two show different views of a solar flare.


NASA has more on the science behind the images on the stamps and the whole set of stamps are available for purchase online.
See also A Decade of the Sun.
Tags: astronomy¬†¬† design¬†¬† NASA¬†¬† science¬†¬† stamps¬†¬† Sun¬†¬† USPS
articles.title: New USPS Stamps Celebrate the Sun

articles.description:
Sometimes you run across an aspect of reality and it just completely blows your mind. You‚Äôve heard of dark matter, right? Well, meet dark fish: biologists suspect that up to 95% of the world‚Äôs total fish population lives in a deep layer of the ocean that is difficult to detect and we know little about.
An international team of marine biologists has found mesopelagic fish in the earth‚Äôs oceans constitute 10 to 30 times more biomass than previously thought.
UWA Professor Carlos Duarte says mesopelagic fish ‚Äî fish that live between 100 and 1000m below the surface ‚Äî must therefore constitute 95 per cent of the world‚Äôs fish biomass.
‚ÄúBecause the stock is much larger it means this layer must play a more significant role in the functioning of the ocean and affecting the flow of carbon and oxygen in the ocean,‚Äù he says.


See also this thread from ocean scientist Andrew Thaler:
There‚Äôs a globe-spanning layer of mesopelagic fish that is so dense it distorts SONAR. For decades we had no idea what created the Deep Scattering Layer or why it moved. We still know almost nothing about it.


It‚Äôs astounding how much we don‚Äôt know about the ocean:
There‚Äôs an entire family of whales with at least 22 species that we know almost nothing about.


We know way more about stars that are billions of light years away than about some parts of the ocean a few hundred feet below the surface of our own planet.
See also dark fungi: ‚ÄúBy one estimate, there are between 2.2 million and 3.8 million species of fungi ‚Äî and more than 90% of them aren‚Äôt cataloged.‚Äù. (via @_zeets & @chadmumm)
Tags: Andrew Thaler¬†¬† fish¬†¬† science
articles.title: Dark Fish

This short documentary takes a look at the Black surfing community in the Rockaways. These surfers are members of the Black Surfing Association (East Coast branch), which Surfer magazine profiled last summer:
‚ÄúWhen you talk to kids here at Rockaway, they think of a surfer as John John Florence ‚Äî blonde,‚Äù says Harris. ‚ÄúWhen I say, ‚ÄòHey, I‚Äôm a surfer,‚Äô they‚Äôre shocked. We‚Äôre trying to reach every kid, but we‚Äôre really trying to reach the kids that wouldn‚Äôt otherwise get the opportunity.
We just want to keep kids busy and active, and spread the message and spread the stoke of surfing, and go into schools and talk to kids about water safety.‚Äù
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no racism out there‚Äù, says Harris of the ocean. ‚ÄúWhen you come out of that water, of course you go back to your life. But you lose yourself when you get into the waves.‚Äù


 Tags: NYC¬†¬† surfing¬†¬† video
articles.title: The Freedom to Be: Black Surfers in the Rockaways

articles.description:
Stevie Wonder. Mahalia Jackson. Nina Simone. Gladys Knight & the Pips. B.B. King. Sly and the Family Stone. Over six weeks in the summer of 1969, all of these legendary artists (and more!) performed at the Harlem Cultural Festival in NYC, drawing an estimated 300,000 people. The festival was filmed and broadcast on a local TV station, but the footage was never commercially released and so unlike that other 1969 festival, this event largely slipped from public memory.
Now, the Harlem Cultural Festival finally gets its due in the form of Summer of Soul, a forthcoming documentary directed by Questlove that uses that old footage to great effect. I‚Äôve heard nothing but good things about this movie ‚Äî it won both the Grand Jury Prize and the Audience Award at the Sundance Film Festival earlier this year. Summer of Soul is out in theaters and on Hulu July 2.
Tags: movies¬†¬† music¬†¬† NYC¬†¬† Questlove¬†¬† Summer of Soul¬†¬† trailers¬†¬† video
articles.title: Summer of Soul

articles.description:
From Electric Vehicles Won‚Äôt Save Us by Coby Lefkowitz:
This isn‚Äôt a story about Elon Musk, or Tesla, or a contrarian take about how ‚Äúoil is good, actually.‚Äù I unconditionally support electric vehicles in their quest to take over the primacy of gasoline-powered vehicles in the market. But I don‚Äôt save that enthusiasm for their prospects on society broadly. From the perspective of the built environment, there is nothing functionally different between an electric vehicle and a gasoline propelled one. The relationship is the same, and it‚Äôs unequivocally destructive. Cars, however they‚Äôre powered, are environmentally cataclysmic, break the tethers of community, and force an infrastructure of dependency that is as financially ruinous to our country as it is dangerous to us as people. In order to build a more sustainable future and a better world for humanity, we need to address the root problems that have brought us to where we so perilously lie today.


 Tags: cars¬†¬† cities¬†¬† Coby Lefkowitz¬†¬† global warming¬†¬† USA
articles.title: EVs Won‚Äôt Save Us from Our Car Culture‚Äôs Ill Effects

articles.description:
Clinton Jones challenged his community of 3D artists to interpret a simple animation of a person walking with a heavy load. 2400 people participated and Jones collected the 100 renders for this video. What a fantastic illustration of the power of constraints and the abundance of human creativity. Ok, much of the imagery is borrowed from Star Wars and other sci-fi universes, but the stuff that isn‚Äôt is delightful. Even with no explicit narrative connection between the scenes, somehow this all seems like part of one big journey. One of the simplest stories we tell is someone moving from one place to another and it doesn‚Äôt need to be The Odyssey, Fury Road, or Thelma & Louise to be compelling.
You can also watch a video featuring all 2400 entries (it‚Äôs 2h 45m long) and a montage from a previous challenge featuring 125 artists.
See also Transfiguration: An Ever-Evolving Walking Figure. (via waxy)
Tags: 3D¬†¬† Clinton Jones¬†¬† video
articles.title: 100 3D Artists Interpret the Same Scene of a Walking Person

articles.description:
Well, this is cool: a recently discovered minor planet estimated to be between 62 and 230 miles across is currently journeying through our solar system and sometime in 2031 will be almost as close to the Sun as Saturn.
And it turns out, astronomers are about to witness the closest pass of this incredible round trip. Currently, 2014 UN271 is about 22 Astronomical Units (AU) from the Sun (for reference, Earth is 1 AU from the Sun). That means it‚Äôs already closer than Neptune, at 29.7 AU. And it‚Äôs not stopping there ‚Äî it‚Äôs already traveled 7 AU in the last seven years, and at its closest in 2031, it‚Äôs expected to pass within 10.9 AU of the Sun, almost reaching the orbit of Saturn.
Before then, it‚Äôs expected to develop the characteristic coma and tail of a comet, as icy material on its surface vaporizes from the heat of the Sun. This close pass would give astronomers an unprecedented close look at Oort cloud objects.


C‚Äômon NASA, let‚Äôs a get a probe fired up and visit this very unusual object!
Tags: astronomy¬†¬† science¬†¬† space
articles.title: Unexpected Minor Planet to Visit the Inner Solar System Soon

articles.description:
In a TEDx Talk from 2017, LB Hannahs talks about their experience as a transgender dad, comfort vs authenticity, and the collision of theoretical gender roles & identities with the practicalities of parenthood.
Now, for most people, what their child will call them is not something that they give much thought to outside of culturally specific words or variations on a gendered theme like ‚Äúmama,‚Äù ‚Äúmommy,‚Äù or ‚Äúdaddy,‚Äù ‚Äúpapa.‚Äù But for me, the possibility is what this child, who will grow to be a teenager and then a real-life adult, will call me for the rest of our lives, was both extremely scary and exciting. And I spent nine months wrestling with the reality that being called ‚Äúmama‚Äù or something like it didn‚Äôt feel like me at all. And no matter how many times or versions of ‚Äúmom‚Äù I tried, it always felt forced and deeply uncomfortable. I knew being called ‚Äúmom‚Äù or ‚Äúmommy‚Äù would be easier to digest for most people. The idea of having two moms is not super novel, especially where we live. 
So I tried other words. And when I played around with ‚Äúdaddy,‚Äù it felt better. Better, but not perfect. It felt like a pair of shoes that you really liked but you needed to wear and break in. And I knew the idea of being a female-born person being called ‚Äúdaddy‚Äù was going to be a harder road with a lot more uncomfortable moments. But, before I knew it, the time had come and Elliot came screaming into the world, like most babies do, and my new identity as a parent began. I decided on becoming a daddy, and our new family faced the world.


(thx, megan)
Tags: gender¬†¬† LB Hannahs¬†¬† LGBT¬†¬† parenting¬†¬† video
articles.title: What It‚Äôs Like to Be a Transgender Dad

articles.description:
Production designers working on science fiction movies and TV shows are part-time magicians because they routinely have to invent the future using things from the present. The site Star Trek + Design is collecting the futuristic design objects ‚Äî chairs, cups, silverware, sofas ‚Äî that designers used on the sets of Star Trek movies and TV shows to depict the future.
Being drawn to the aesthetics of Trek, especially of The Next Generation, made me curious about the specific objects that set designers used to create the visual embodiment of what living and working on a starship would look like in a technologically-advanced, post-scarcity future.


For instance, this is an RBT Chair by Teknion used in Star Trek: Discovery:

Park Avenue glasses made by Anchor Hocking were used for barware in TNG:

Voyager used Arne Jacobsen‚Äôs AJ Flatware in several episodes (as did Kubrick‚Äôs 2001):

Check out the site for many more sourced objects.
See also Film and Furniture, a Site About the Decor in Movies.
Tags: design¬†¬† movies¬†¬† Star Trek¬†¬† TV
articles.title: Sourcing Design Objects Used in Star Trek

articles.description:
Obviously, there are trees. But speaking phylogenetically, trees aren‚Äôt a thing. Some things that are trees evolved from things that are not trees and other things that are trees evolved into things that aren‚Äôt trees. Confused? This might clear things up.
‚ÄúTrees‚Äù are not a coherent phylogenetic category. On the evolutionary tree of plants, trees are regularly interspersed with things that are absolutely, 100% not trees. This means that, for instance, either:
The common ancestor of a maple and a mulberry tree was not a tree.


See also there‚Äôs no such thing as a vegetable and there‚Äôs no such thing as a fish.
What would the evolutionary tree of salmon, lungfish, and cows be? The answer, it appears at first glance, is simple. Salmon and lungfish, being fish, would cluster nicely together on one branch, and very non-fishy cows would be off on a separate branch. Right? Wrong. Contrary to what you might expect, what you see above is their evolutionary tree. Working up from the root, the lineage that leads to salmon branches off first. Keep tracing up the tree, and you‚Äôll see that the lineage from which the salmon branched off eventually branches into two new lineages: the one leading to lungfish and the other leading to cows. In other words, a cow and a lungfish are more closely related to one another than either is to salmon.


(via @smorewithface)
Tags: evolution¬†¬† science¬†¬† trees
articles.title: There‚Äôs No Such Thing as a Tree

In Akira Kurosawa‚Äôs 1950 film Rashomon, the story of the murder of a samurai is told from several different viewpoints and each account of the event is different and even contradictory. In real life as in cinema, the Rashomon Effect describes how events can be recalled in contradictory ways by well-meaning but ultimately subjective witnesses. In this short TED-Ed video, the Rashomon Effect and its implications are explained and explored. (via open culture)

articles.title: The Rashomon Effect

articles.description:
Perhaps the most consequential day in the Earth‚Äôs recent history was when a massive asteroid struck the planet 66 million years ago. It resulted in earthquakes, tsunamis, fireballs raining from the sky, volcanoes, atmospheric heat shocks, wildfires, global winter, and the extinction of 75% of all species on Earth, including the dinosaurs. This video by Kurzgesagt leads us through what happened that day, minute by minute.
This video reminded me of Peter Brannen‚Äôs eye-popping description of this event from his book The Ends of the World:
‚ÄúThe meteorite itself was so massive that it didn‚Äôt notice any atmosphere whatsoever,‚Äù said Rebolledo. ‚ÄúIt was traveling 20 to 40 kilometers per second, 10 kilometers ‚Äî probably 14 kilometers ‚Äî wide, pushing the atmosphere and building such incredible pressu‚Ä¶
articles.title: A Minute by Minute Account of the Day the Dinosaurs Died

articles.description:
Using publicly available datasets of English words, their etymologies, and their semantic distances, software engineer Daniel de Haas generated pairs & triples of words that have a common origin but otherwise are unrelated to each other. 
‚Äúactor‚Äù & ‚Äúcoagulate‚Äù
Both of these words derive ultimately from the Latin ‚Äúago‚Äù, meaning ‚Äúact‚Äù, ‚Äúdo‚Äù, ‚Äúmake‚Äù, and a bunch of other things.
English ‚Äúactor‚Äù is a short hop away from ‚Äúago‚Äù, but ‚Äúcoagulate‚Äù takes a longer path: ‚Äúago‚Äù ‚ûî ‚Äúcogo‚Äù (‚Äúcollect‚Äù) ‚ûî ‚Äúcoagulum‚Äù (‚Äúa clot‚Äù) ‚ûî ‚Äúcoagulo‚Äù (‚Äúto clot‚Äù).



‚Äúeducate‚Äù & ‚Äúsubdue‚Äù
‚ÄúEducate‚Äù comes from the Latin ‚Äúeductus‚Äù, meaning to ‚Äúlead or bring out‚Äù, and then the Latin ‚Äúeducare‚Äù (‚Äúraise, train, mould‚Äù). I love the image of education as the process of extruding a refined person out of a base of unrefined material.
‚ÄúSubdue‚Äù comes from the latin ‚Äúsubduco‚Äù, meaning ‚Äúlead under‚Äù. Again, a very clear physical description of what the word means ‚Äî to put beneath you, or bring under control.


 Tags: Daniel de Haas¬†¬† language
articles.title: Surprising Shared Word Origins
